docs.lead_paragraph: Planned Parenthood filed a lawsuit in federal court seeking to block a South Dakota law that would require women seeking abortions to face the nation’s longest waiting period and undergo counseling.

headline.main: South Dakota: Suit Challenges Abortion Restrictions

docs.lead_paragraph: Carla Bruni-Sarkozy arrived at the Group of Eight summit meeting in Deauville, France, on Thursday and made no effort to hide her rounded belly as she posed for photographs.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study finds that among affluent, educated families, sex-selective abortions of girls have spread nationwide during the past two decades.

docs.lead_paragraph: Let’s dispense first with a few housekeeping details: The future Lady McCartney did her duty as a board member of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority by attending committee hearings on Monday. Some had wondered if she would show up. She did.

headline.main: Paying More to Wait Longer for the Subway

docs.abstract: The Day: Train service isn’t what it was as recently as a year ago, conspicuously on the numbered lines that the transportation authority still quaintly lumps together as the IRT. Also, what City Room is reading in other papers and blogs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of home births rose 20 percent nationwide from 2004 through 2008, though they were still a small fraction of total births, according to a new study.

headline.seo: Home Births on the Rise in United States
headline.main: Childbirth: Home Births Are Uncommon but on the Rise
headline.print_headline: CHILDBIRTH: Home Births Are Uncommon but on the Rise

docs.lead_paragraph: Q.Why do fingernails grow faster than toenails? And why do the growth rates vary as I age? A. The exact mechanisms that control the speed of fingernail and toenail growth are unknown, said Jeffrey S. Dover, associate clinical professor of dermatology at the Yale School of Medicine, but it is established that fingernails do grow about three times as fast as toenails.
docs.abstract: Science Q&A on different growth rates of toenails and fingernails; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: The exact mechanisms that control the speed of nail growth are unknown, but it is established that fingernails grow about three times as fast as toenails.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of home births nationwide rose 20 percent from 2004 through 2008, a new study shows. Even with the increase, there were just 28,357 home births in 2008, less than 1 percent of the 4.2 million births in the United States that year. Still, the increase reversed a downward trend in such births since 1990.

headline.main: CHILDBIRTH: Home Births Are Uncommon but on the Rise

docs.abstract: Study published online in journal Birth: Issues in Perinatal Care finds number of home births in United States rose 20 percent from 2004 through 2008 (M)
docs.snippet: The number of home births rose 20 percent nationwide from 2004 through 2008, though they were still a small fraction of total births, according to a new study.
